page.title: 09HOUSING - HARMSTON & COLEBY
page.content: Houses here are in demand for their setting among trees, pantiled stone walls and stone farm buildings. Stone cottages set tightly onto the pavement defining lane corners, are mixed with modern brick houses of more open character.{ Harmston}&{Coleby}are defined as minor service villages, preserved by strict curtilage defined by the cliff edge and the A607 road. The approx. 125 dwellings in{Harmston} include 18 hospital houses, 5 tied farm houses and 16 council houses. The approx. 160 dwellings in{Coleby} include the converted flats of Coleby Hall,6 tied farm houses and 35 council houses which are rather cut off by the A607 road. Most houses are modernised. All have indoor sanitation. New houses have double glazing and electric or solid fuel central heating. '
